title: Fermat's theorem (stationary points)
summary: In mathematics, Fermat's theorem (also known as interior extremum theorem) is a method to find local maxima and minima of differentiable functions on open sets by showing that every local extremum of the function is a stationary point (the function's derivative is zero at that point).  Fermat's theorem is a theorem in real analysis, named after Pierre de Fermat.
